author: sirredbeard
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------

```bash
$ bash <(wget -O - https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/master/tools/install-powershell.sh)
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

wget would download and bash would execute the script from GitHub.

Actual behavior
---------------

```
$ bash <(wget -O - https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/master/tools/install-powershell.sh)
--2018-06-04 18:39:31--  https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/master/tools/install-powershell.sh
Resolving raw.githubusercontent.com (raw.githubusercontent.com)... 151.101.56.133
Connecting to raw.githubusercontent.com (raw.githubusercontent.com)|151.101.56.133|:443... connected.
ERROR: The certificate of ‘raw.githubusercontent.com’ is not trusted.
ERROR: The certificate of ‘raw.githubusercontent.com’ hasn't got a known issuer.
$
```

Environment
---------------
Running on Debian 9 on WSL, freshly updated.
title: Certificate errors breaking install-powershell.sh
